message: Signing the Oath of Office with my wife and favorite constituent, Jeanne. I'm honored and humbled to be part of the 115th Congress and look forward to continuing to represent California's 8th District.

Today, I introduced the Veterans’ Education Equity Act, important bipartisan legislation to ensure that our student veterans are getting a fair and reasonable housing benefit so they can afford to complete their education. We must protect the benefits our veterans earned while defending this nation. http://bit.ly/2j60WRm

I have reintroduced the HIRE Vets Act, legislation that would promote private sector recruiting, hiring, and retaining of men and women who served honorably in the U.S. military. This bipartisan bill passed the House with unanimous support during the last Congress but was not able to pass the Senate before the end of the year. Veterans who serve this country honorably shouldn’t struggle to find employment.

Today is Law Enforcement Appreciation Day, a day to acknowledge the contributions that men and women in uniform make on a daily basis to keep our communities safe. If you see a police officer today, be sure to take a minute to thank them. #ThankACop

Attention High Desert Veterans: Veterans residing in the Victorville area that have medical appointments at the main VA Loma Linda Healthcare System now have access to free bus service to the facility. I’ve advocated for this service for quite some time, so I’m pleased to see it come to fruition. Spread the word so that veterans know about it and use it.  http://bit.ly/2jcDqWH
Today we remember Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., a courageous leader and a voice for equality.
One of the remarkable hallmarks of our republic is the peaceful transition of power regardless of party affiliation. I was proud and honored to witness this occur today.
With all of the recent rains and snow, be sure to follow Caltrans for the latest on road conditions in the area. Stay safe! https://twitter.com/Caltrans8

I reintroduced the Private Corrado Piccoli Purple Heart Preservation Act, which prohibits the sale of any Purple Heart medal presented by the government to a wounded servicemember or the servicemember’s family. I’m committed to defending our Veterans, and that means preserving their symbols of honor like the Purple Heart. These medals belong with families or in museums, not on an auction block. http://bit.ly/2jS7U09
Great to meet with Head Start of San Bernardino County today. They are doing some incredible work in the district to provide early education to low income families. #CA08inDC

Great article by the Victorville Daily Press on Andrew Espinoza Jr, who I had the pleasure of nominating to attend the United States Air Force Academy. Congratulations Andrew!   http://www.vvdailypress.com/news/20170124/barstow-high-senior-eager-to-achieve
Great start to the year for Mammoth Mountain with a record-setting snow fall. If you haven't been to Mammoth Lakes, CA this would be a perfect time to visit!

I issued the following statement on the temporary immigration ban. While I encourage open discussion, inflammatory remarks will be removed and violators might be prevented from posting in the future. My staff will be closely monitoring this thread. Please keep your comments civil and constructive. Thank you. http://bit.ly/2kM1EoF

I issued the following statement on President Trump’s intention to nominate Neil Gorsuch to the United States Supreme Court:  “Judge Gorsuch is an outstanding choice for the Supreme Court. I’m extremely impressed with his background and am confident he will be a superb independent voice on the court. I’m confident Judge Gorsuch will not legislate from the bench, and will help restore the parameters for the courts as envisioned by our country’s founders. When he was appointed in 2006 to serve on 10th Circuit Court of Appeals, he received unanimous Senate support. Judge Gorsuch is a worthy replacement for Judge Antonin Scalia, and he should do well to help restore faith in the highest court of the land.”
NA
Congratulations Sultana wrestling team!
Today I reintroduced the Secure E-waste Export and Recycling Act (SEERA), a national security bill that will protect our military and create thousands of good-paying American jobs.

Today, I spoke on the House floor before the HIRE Vets Act of 2017 was passed with overwhelming support. I'm glad to see this beneficial legislation move quickly and I look forward to it passing the Senate and being signed into law. We must always support our veterans!

My office partnered with local schools and Operation Gratitude to send Valentines to our servicemembers overseas. The 8th District is home to five military installations and countless constituents serving our country every day. I'm always looking for ways to support our troops and show them gratitude for all that they do to keep us safe.

Wildfires such as the North Fire and Lake Fire in San Bernardino County have caused devastating effects in my district. Today, I introduced the Wildfire Airspace Protection Act of 2017 that will institute a criminal penalty on anyone who launches a drone that interferes with fighting wildfires on federal property. We must keep our firefighters safe and remove any unnecessary obstacles to stop these catastrophic disasters.
Stay safe tonight and follow Caltrans District 8 for updates on local road conditions.

The future of the Affordable Care Act – aka Obamacare – is one of the most important issues facing Congress this year. While the ACA has done some good things – such as permitting those under the age of 26 to remain on their parents insurance and allowed those with pre-existing conditions to get the insurance they need – too many people have seen the dream of affordable healthcare turn into a nightmare of higher costs, fewer choices, and a tangled web of burdensome regulations.   I believe a “repeal and replace” strategy will serve our country best and allow the greatest number of Americans a chance to improve their healthcare situation. We need a plan that makes it easier for employers to offer affordable healthcare options for their employees and allows greater freedom for people to purchase a plan of their choice.   As we consider these changes the ACA, I want to hear your thoughts. Please be respectful and stay on topic. Please keep your comments on ACA confined to this post, as I’ve had too many off-topic conversations in other posts. Thank you.

It was a pleasure to meet with representatives from all three counties in my district yesterday and today. We covered a variety of topics including public health, fire safety, local infrastructure, and public lands. Thank you San Bernardino County (Supervisor James Ramos, Supervisor Robert Lovingood, and Supervisor Janice Rutherford), Inyo County (Supervisor Matt Kingsley and Supervisor Jeff Griffiths) and Mono County (Supervisor Stacy Corless and Supervisor Bob Gardner) for your continued dedication to our communities.
Taking time between meetings today to read your comments on my ACA post yesterday. I'll respond to some of your questions later this afternoon.
NA

Community Alert - "Fire crews from the San Bernardino National Forest will be working in the vicinity of Oak Glen and Banning on the Oak Glen/Banning Community Defense Project burning as early as Monday of next week. . .Crews will burn approximately 50 acres between the three locations, smoke will be visible to commuters in the Banning Pass, Yucaipa, Mentone and Oak Glen. . .Updates for this prescribe burn will be available on the San Bernardino National Forest’s social media sites Facebook and Twitter."
Met with some of our brave San Bernardino County Firefighters today. Thank you for your invaluable service to our community!
At a Foreign Affairs hearing on stopping Russian interference in democratic elections across Europe. This is a serious threat that requires a coordinated response from NATO.
Check out my video response to today's hearing on Russian interference in European elections
Great story!
This week's zippo brief covering the healthcare bill we will be voting on next week.
NA
Join me tomorrow for a Tele-Townhall. I'll be answering your questions and giving a general update on some upcoming legislation.

My experience in Vietnam changed my life forever, and I am a better person because of it.  Veterans of my generation often feel complex emotions when relating our service to our friends and family, which is partly a result of the public’s reaction to the war at that time.  The key to resolving these issues is that our nation recognizes the generation of men and women who served in the war.  Yesterday, President Trump signed the Vietnam War Veterans Recognition Act into law, which designated March 29 as National Vietnam War Veterans Day.  I applaud this effort in honoring our Vietnam Veterans.  For all Americans, I encourage you to take this day to learn about the conflict and if possible, speak to Veterans about their experiences.  For all the Vietnam Veterans in our district, I want to say “Thank you for answering our nation’s call,” on our first Vietnam Veterans Day.
That's a wrap! Thanks to everyone who called or listened in to tonight's Tele-Townhall. We had some great questions, and I'll post the poll results as soon as possible.
Please share this post to help find these fossils stolen from Death Valley National Park and call the ISB Tip Line 888-653-0009 if you have any information that could lead to their recovery.

Eight years ago, after a long legislative battle, I stood with Governor Schwarzenegger as he signed my legislation for Welcome Home Vietnam Veterans Day into California state law. Today, March 30, we honor and thank our Vietnam veterans for their sacrifice and service.

Today, I voted to encourage the State Department to restore North Korea’s place on the list of official state sponsors of terrorism.  We must not stand by while North Korea continues to disregarded sanctions and support international terrorism.

Below are the results of the poll questions from my Tele-Townhall last week. Thanks to the more than 3,500 people who participated in the call in total. It was great to hear your questions and get this poll feedback. Next to the percentages you will see the total number of votes for each answer. Not everyone participated in each poll question. I’m looking forward to my next Tele-Townhall and future polls.

Last night the President showed that America is willing to back up its words with action. Assad's use of chemical weapons on defenseless civilians necessitated a swift response and shows that these senseless attacks will not go unanswered.

In honor of National Park Week please comment some of your favorite National Park pictures from the district. Here is one Jeanne and I took late last year in Joshua Tree. Admission will be waived at all parks April 22-23 so get out and #FindYourPark
My office extended the submission deadline for the Congressional Art Competition. See the new dates below!

We had a record breaking number of entries in this years Congressional Art Competition. Each student did a great job and I'm very proud of them. I'll be announcing the winners on Monday, May 8th here on Facebook. In the meantime check out some of our 100+ entries for yourself.

Thanks to every student who participated in the 2017 Congressional Art Competition. There were a record number of student entries for our district this year, which made selecting a winner very difficult. Here are the finalists for our district: 1st place: Jasmine Rodriguez- Hesperia High School 2nd place: Jessica Rojo- Apple Valley High School 3rd place: Julissa Espinoza- Silverado High School I look forward to Jasmine joining me in Washington for the Congressional Art Reception on June 29th!
Happy Mother's Day to my beautiful wife and all of the wonderful moms in the world. Jeanne and I found this fitting heart-shaped cactus on our walk this morning.
Thank you to all the men and women who risk their lives daily to keep our communities safe.

Today, as we recognize National Police Week, the House passed the Thin Blue Line Act. Every day, our first responders are risking their lives to protect our communities and when someone takes the life of a law enforcement officer or firefighter, they need to be appropriately punished.
Today, my office presented Deputy Jeffrey Dean with a Congressional Record insert recognizing him for going above and beyond with this selfless act of kindness.

Today, the House unanimously passed the Child Protection Improvements Act of 2017, giving organizations that provide services to youth, the elderly, and the disabled access to the FBI fingerprint database to perform thorough background checks on employees and volunteers.

Today I spoke in favor of H. Res 355, which condems the terrorist attack in Manchester. I co-sponsored this measure which passed out of the House Foreign Affairs Committee unanimously. The British and American people are no strangers to outside enemies wishing to destroy our way of life. We have stood side by side to triumph in these fights before, and have become stronger partners for the fights to come. https://youtu.be/IaynEiG4adI
Jeanne and I are having a great time at Mule Days! We always enjoy spending time in this beautiful and historic community.
Jeanne and I went on a fantastic tour of Bodie ghost town in Mono County today. We learned a lot about this historic part of California and couldn't have wished for better weather!

Today we remember those who paid the ultimate sacrifice to keep our country free. I was honored to speak at the American Legion Post 457 Memorial Day ceremony in Big Pine. I am always so inspired by the patriotic event this community hosts every year.

I spoke at the Veteran's Resource Fair in Apple Valley yesterday. If you or anyone you know needs VA assistance please contact my district office at 760-247-1815. We processed over 400 cases last year!

This morning, I had a great meeting with the Secretary of State Rex Tillerson. As the Vice Chairman of the Foreign Affairs Committee, I look forward to working closely with him in the months and years ahead to protect our national security interests and promote America abroad.
My family is my greatest accomplishment. Happy Father's Day to all!

Holcomb Fire outside Big Bear Lake is currently 10% contained. While over 1,000 firefighters are working to contain the fire, Forest Service Investigators are asking for the public's assistance to help establish the cause of the Holcomb Fire which started on Monday June 19. Call (909) 382-2699 if you have any information and follow InciWeb for continued updates.

Today, the House unanimously passed the Santa Ana River Wash Land Plan Exchange Act, a bill I authored to complete an exchange of land between the San Bernardino Valley Water Conservation District and the BLM. The Wash Plan will allow for the expansion of existing aggregate mining operations to support infrastructure, protect water recharge in the wash and manage critical habitat for threatened and endangered plants and animals. I’m grateful to Rep. Aguilar for co-sponsoring this bipartisan bill and thank my colleagues for passing the bill today.

Today the House passed "Kate's Law", a bill that protects the public by enhancing penalties for deported illegal felons who return to the United States and commit additional crimes. I strongly support this bill and look forward to it being signed into law.

We have a long way to go on this rail spur proposal, but this is an important first step, and I intend to see it through. We have an opportunity to save taxpayer dollars, increase the readiness of Army combat brigades, and provide an environmental benefit. I’ll continue to advocate for this proposal as the defense bill moves forward. http://www.desertdispatch.com/news/20170629/rep-cook-seeks-funding-for-rail-spur-to-armys-national-training-center

Today, my staff was able to attend the change of command ceremony today at Ft. Irwin. Colonel Scott Taylor handed over command of the Ft. Irwin Garrison to Colonel Seth Krummrich. It was a pleasure to work with Colonel Taylor the past two years, and I wish him the best of luck as he heads to Korea to serve as the 8th Army G3. I would also like to welcome Colonel Krummrich and his family to Ft. Irwin, and I look forward to supporting the National Training Center’s mission to train, fight, and win!

I received a copy of a petition from over 1,500 Lake Arrowhead area residents sent to the FAA requesting that they re-instate a previous flight path in the Lake Arrowhead region. I personally sent a letter to the FAA regarding this matter, and I can tell you, I’m not satisfied with their response.   Without proper community notice or engagement, the FAA recently changed inbound aircraft flight plans serving the Ontario airport and re-routed them to a new path that flies directly over several mountain communities in my district including Lake Arrowhead, Blue Jay, Crestline, Arrowbear, Running Springs, Skyforest, Rimforest, Twin Peaks, Green Valley Lake, and Deer Lodge Park. My constituents deserve more, which is why I’m not letting the FAA off the hook. I’ll keep fighting to change back these flight paths and to get the answers my constituents need.
Great to have Walter, Shannon, Reed, and Nico visit the office today all the way from Yucca Valley! #CA08inDC
NA

I would like to thank our district intern Jessica for all of her help this summer! She was vital in assisting the staff with legislative projects and recording the concerns of our constituents. I wish her the best as she begins her courses at Chaffey College where she hopes to study civil engineering and eventually transfer to a university.
NA
We will never forget the terror attacks our country endured and we will always honor those lives we lost at the World Trade Center, at the Pentagon, and on Flight 93.
NA
Beautiful day in Twentynine Palms celebrating Pioneer Days with Jeanne.

Today marks the 34th anniversary of the attack on the US Marine barracks in Beirut, which killed 241 US Service Members. Hezbollah, with backing from Iran, was responsible for this attack. My former unit, the 1st Battalion, 8th Marines, was stationed at the barracks, and I lost many friends that day. I’ll never forget the sacrifices of those brave US Service Members, and we best honor their memories by remaining ever vigilant in our war on terror.
Check out my latest zippo brief on Iran, Hezbollah, what I'm reading, and more.

Today, I was named Chairman of the House Foreign Affairs Subcommittee on the Western Hemisphere. I’m honored to further the good work of the subcommittee and the work of my friend and full-committee Chairman Ed Royce in promoting American interests in the Western Hemisphere.

Yesterday, the House passed the Iran Ballistic Missiles and International Sanctions Enforcement Act, expanding sanctions against Iran for its illicit ballistic missile program. Iran is the most serious threat we face in the Middle East, and if we don’t push back now, Iran’s reach, influence, and support for terrorists will plague the world for years to come.

Over the weekend, US Special Operations Forces captured Mustafa al-Imam, one of the ringleaders involved in the 2012 terror attack in Benghazi that killed four Americans, including our ambassador to Libya. I applaud the bravery of our men and women in uniform who brought this killer to justice. We’ll never forget the lives that were lost in Benghazi, and we won’t rest until all terrorists responsible are brought to justice.

Too often we see pictures of terrorists who are apprehended without seeing those who are on the frontlines protecting us. Officer Ryan Nash stopped the terror attack in New York.  I commend him for his bravery and thank all the men and women in law enforcement keeping us safe everyday.

Do you know a veteran in our community who works tirelessly on behalf of veterans causes? Please consider nominating them for recognition at my annual “Heroes of the 8th” veterans recognition ceremony, which will be held on December 19, 2017. The deadline for submitting nominations is November 24, 2017. If you’d like to nominate a veteran, please complete the form at the following link:  https://cook.house.gov/sites/cook.house.gov/files/wysiwyg_uploaded/10-31-17%20Nomination%20Form.pdf.  Please make sure to submit your nomination ASAP!
Watch my latest zippo brief including my first impressions of the proposed tax reform bill that was released today. I'll be doing another video update once I finish reviewing the whole bill.

On Wednesday I'll be chairing my first hearing for the Foreign Affairs Subcommittee on the Western Hemisphere. This hearing will explore the effectiveness of U.S. counter-narcotics operations using the 1999 Kingpin Act to target global criminal networks involved in drug trafficking. In view of the current drug crisis, it's critical that we review our existing counternarcotics measures and make any adjustments necessary to keep these illegal drugs out of our country.

Today I held my first official meeting as the Chairman of the Western Hemisphere Subcommittee with Ambassador Camilo Reyes of Colombia. We discussed how Colombia and the US work together in the fight against the drug cartels and possible ways to expand that partnership so we can more effectively counter narcotics trafficking organizations. Improved stability in Colombia will have a significant positive impact on the rest of the Western Hemisphere.
Honored to participate in the 242nd Marine Corps Birthday Cake Cutting Ceremony this morning. Semper Fi!

Today I held my first hearing as Chairman of the House Foreign Affairs Subcommittee on the Western Hemisphere. We discussed the effectiveness of the Foreign Narcotics Kingpin Designation Act and ways we can improve this legislation to better prevent drug trafficking. Our expert panel of witnesses provided the Committee with some great advice and I look forward to working with my colleagues to improve our counter-narcotics efforts.

Happy Veterans Day!

It was an honor to participate in the Veterans Day and Gold Star Memorial Dedication Ceremony in Big Bear Lake on Saturday. The American Legion and Marine Corps League organized a great event to honor the men and women, past and present, who’ve served in our Armed Forces. It was an emotional event for me and the other veterans in attendance, but it’s important that we never forget the sacrifices made for America.

The deadline for submitting nominations is November 24, 2017. If you’d like to nominate a veteran, please complete the form at the following link: https://cook.house.gov/sites/cook.house.gov/files/wysiwyg_uploaded/10-31-17%20Nomination%20Form.pdf Please make sure to submit your nomination ASAP!
NA

Several months ago some of my Lake Arrowhead constituents notified me that the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) had rerouted a flight path into Ontario airport, causing the jets to fly extremely low over mountain communities and disrupting the residents' daily lives. Since then my office has worked in conjunction with community leaders to get answers from the FAA and to reroute the flight path away from Lake Arrowhead. I commend the hard work done by Lake Arrowhead residents to raise the profile of this critical local issue, and I’ll continue to demand results from the FAA here in Washington.
Happy Thanksgiving from the Cook family!

Great work by San Bernardino County Sheriff’s Deputy Clay Lacey, who helped an Apple Valley family recover from a home invasion robbery. It’s reassuring to know that deputies like Clay are protecting our communities and putting their lives on the line for our safety.

Today I met with West Point Cadets visiting the Capitol as part of the Margaret Corbin Forum to discuss unique issues women face in the military.  In the next few years, these Cadets will commission as Lieutenants in the US Army to lead American Soldiers at home and abroad.

I stopped by the Marine Corps liaison office this morning to drop off a truck for the Toys for Tots program. Colonel Ostrowski and his office started collecting toys yesterday and their box is already full!

Today, I voted in support of the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act. This bill will reduce taxes for AT LEAST 91% of my constituents through the doubling of the ‘standard deduction’ and the expansion of the child tax credit alone. Here’s the proof: real examples of how the bill will reduce taxes for people at every stage of life.
Merry Christmas from the Cook house!
